steps.title: Open the Manage World menu.
steps.content: Open the Manage World menu. Click ⋯ in the top-right corner of the screen, then click Manage World in the resulting menu. [1] X Research source A prompt will appear asking if you'd like to save the game. This is a good idea, just in case you change your mind or delete the wrong Sim by accident.

steps.title: Select the Sim's house.
steps.content: Select the Sim's house. Find the house in which the Sim currently lives, then click the house in question.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It's in the lower-right side of the screen. Additional options will appear there.

steps.title: Click the "Manage Household" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Manage Household" icon. This house-shaped icon is in the lower-right side of the screen. Doing so opens the "Manage Household" window, which displays a list of Sims currently living in the house. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Edit" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Edit" icon. It's a pencil-shaped icon in the lower-right side of the "Manage Household" window. The Sims editor will open.

steps.title: Select a Sim.
steps.content: Select a Sim. Hover your mouse cursor over the head of the Sim whom you want to remove. You'll find the head in the lower-left corner of the screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the X to appear.
steps.content: Wait for the X to appear. After a second or so of hovering your mouse cursor over a Sim's head, you should see a red-and-white X icon appear over their head.

steps.title: Click X.
steps.content: Click X . It's above the Sim's head. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click ✓ when prompted.
steps.content: Click ✓ when prompted. Doing so will confirm your decision and remove the Sim from the game.

steps.title: Move the Sim out of the household instead.
steps.content: Move the Sim out of the household instead. If you just want the Sim out of the household—but don't want to remove it permanently—you can do the following: Open the "Manage Household" menu again. Click the "Transfer" icon, which resembles two arrows, in the bottom-right corner. Click the "Create New Household" icon above the right pane. Click the Sim you would like to transfer. Click the right-facing arrow in between the two panes to move the selected Sim to a new household.

steps.title: Back up your save file.
steps.content: Back up your save file. In The Sims 3, you'll need to resort to cheats to delete your Sim. Doing so has a chance to cause bugs, and in the worst case scenario it can permanently ruin your save file. Back up your game before you begin: Windows — Open This PC , double-click your hard drive, double-click the Program Files folder, open the Electronic Arts folder, open The Sims 3 folder, open the saves folder, find the correct save file and click it, press Ctrl + C , and paste the save file in a different folder by going there and pressing Ctrl + V . Mac — Open Finder , open your user folder, open the Documents folder, open the Electronic Arts folder, open the The Sims 3 folder, open the saves folder, find save file for the game you want to modify and click it, press ⌘ Command + C , and paste the save file in a different folder by going there and pressing ⌘ Command + V .

steps.title: Enable testing cheats.
steps.content: Enable testing cheats. Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + C (or ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + C on a Mac), then type in testingcheatsenabled true and press ↵ Enter . This will enable cheats for your game. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the Sim you want to delete isn't being controlled.
steps.content: Make sure the Sim you want to delete isn't being controlled. You can't delete a Sim which is currently being controlled by you. If you are controlling the Sim whom you want to delete, you can relinquish control by clicking a different Sim.

steps.title: Hold down ⇧ Shift while clicking a Sim.
steps.content: Hold down ⇧ Shift while clicking a Sim. This will bring up a list of Sim options above and around the Sim's head.

steps.title: Click Object….
steps.content: Click Object… . It's above the Sim's head.

steps.title: Click Delete It.
steps.content: Click Delete It . This option should be directly above the Sim's head. Doing so will immediately remove the Sim from your game. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Reset a Sim instead.
steps.content: Reset a Sim instead. If your Sim is acting buggy (such as getting stuck in one location, or falling partway through the floor), you can use a different command to reset it. Open the cheat console again and type resetSim followed by a space and the Sim's full name, then press ↵ Enter . [7] X Research source For example, if the Sim Joira Johnson is stuck, type resetSim Joira Johnson here. This will cancel all the Sim's wishes and moodlets.

steps.title: Try another reset method.
steps.content: Try another reset method. If the reset command doesn't work, use this workaround: [8] X Research source Enter moveObjects on in the cheat console. Enter Buy Mode and pick up your Sim to delete it. Click ⋯ , then select Edit Town . Click the icon that shows two houses. This is the Change Active Household option. Switch to any other household, play for a couple minutes, and then switch back to your bugged family. The "deleted" Sim should reappear near the sidewalk.

steps.title: Find a Sim to delete.
steps.content: Find a Sim to delete. Scroll through your world until you find the Sim you want to delete from FreePlay.

steps.title: Tap the Sim you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the Sim you want to delete. If you're controlling the Sim in question, doing so will open the Sim's options pop-up menu. If you aren't controlling the Sim, tap the green "Switch Selection" icon in the upper-right side of the menu to switch to the selected Sim, then tap the Sim again.

steps.title: Tap the "Delete" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Delete" icon. It's a red and white circle with a slash through it. You'll find this option to the right of the Sim's face at the top of the pop-up menu. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap YES when prompted.
steps.content: Tap YES when prompted. This green button is at the bottom of the pop-up window. Doing so immediately deletes the Sim from your FreePlay game. This decision cannot be undone.
